intro: Ornithoboea lanata, commonly known as the hairy bird's-beak, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive, elongated, and hairy seed pods that resemble a bird's beak, giving it its common name. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange and are arranged in clusters at the base of the plant. Ornithoboea lanata is an important plant in its native ecosystem, providing food and habitat for various insects and small animals.
